title.jp: Order to Be Assigned to the Bokutou Traffic Department

synopsis: Saori realizes her dream of being a cop, and joins the Bokutou traffic department

Goukon is a group date thing that Yoriko gets the gang to try out for a night. Saori doesn’t think it’s appropriate, so the gang spins it around and convince her to go along as an “undercover cop”. It turns out there’s been a purse stealer who’s been frequenting those events. Will Saori be able to do her duty and still have some fun?

A beast has been wreaking havoc by the waterside and the Bokutou station is assigned to chase him. It’s a monkey that Natsumi’s boyfriend has been befriending. They eventually, with his help, are able to find the monkey.

Bokutou station has been modernized to the latest automated police equipment from a robotic vending machine to GPS installations to terminals acting as patrol units. How will the gang deal with the new changes?
A mysterious creature has been rampaging through some local shops

A movie star is caught speeding and asks the station for help in allowing him and his girlfriend, who he’s been hiding from the public, to be able to go on a date without the paparazzi hounding them. The gang works out a decoy plan
Strike man is back and helps Natsumi hunt down a recycling information-theft ring

title.jp: Go Around and Round! The Two's Coffee Cup

synopsis: Ken and Miyuki take Honda's daughter Megumi to an amusement park.

Yoriko’s rival is back and challenges her to a flag team competition in the next parade. Yoriko gets Natsumi, Miyuki, Aoi, and Saori involved. In the meantime, there’s a stalker who has the hots for Yoriko!

Honda gets called away for another job, this time a race mechanic, but Megumi forgets to tell him about an upcoming family event (like father-daughter show and tell) at school. Miyuki rushes to the race site to find Honda, but will it be in time?

title.jp: Major Panic on the Bokutou Line (1)

synopsis: Miyuki and Natsumi have a roommate situation fight, and Natsumi goes off for a while. Miyuki meets up with some engineers who show her a new robot that can do heavy operations. In the meantime a major earthquake hits the area and the subways are shut down. Natsumi is on the subway by the way.

title.jp: Major Panic on the Bokutou Line (2)

synopsis: The gang continue to clear people out of the subway line, but the tunnels are collapsing due to the earthquake aftershocks and water. This blocks out a small group of folks. Will Miyuki be able to save the folks trapped inside, including Natsumi?
A celebrity actress joins the Bokutou police force to practice for her upcoming movie role. Natsumi and her encounter a fake cop that has a self-righteous attitude.

title.jp: C'est Se Bonne, Shaking Loving Heart

synopsis: Nakajima rescues a cat and the gang wants to celebrate. He gets drunk and calls Miyuki who’s running late, to propose and ends up telling her he needs more space from her. Whooops! In the meantime, there’s an assignment where Nakajima and Miyuki are forced to couple up undercover to unravel a food cart related car stereo/equipment theft.

Daimaru’s wife Sena shows up at Nakajima’s house, cooking and cleaning. It turns out she and Daimaru had a fight over Daimaru’s forgetting the day they first met. After having Sena over at the gals’ place, the gang try to figure ways for them to get back together. But the couple is strong willed. Nakajima tries to talk Daimaru into apologizing, but he refuses. Nothing seems to be working. Sena goes driving to their special place on Sunday and meets a guy who still likes her and starts driving aggressively against her, but Daimaru then shows up and all is well.

title.jp: How to Correctly Make an Internet Friend

synopsis: Aoi has been text messaging on the Internet, and now a guy wants to meet her in Tokyo, except he doesn’t know Aoi is a guy. Aoi gets the gang to help chase the guy down

title.jp: A Curse on a Midsummer's Night

synopsis: The gang unintentionally break some sealed up box stand in the park and strange things start happening at Bokutou station. There’s a legend of a police woman who haunts the place. Then the lights go out, there’s blood and heads and all sorts of visions. Miyuki and all start freaking out

Chief tells Natsumi that he has something important to tell her in private. Natsumi thinks Chief might still have some feelings for her. So she struggles between her feelings for Chief and her boyfriend who happens to be in town. Eventually, the Chief gets some time alone with her, and it turns out he was recommending Natsumi for a promotion.

Natsumi thinks about her promotion to the special forces. She talks with her boyfriend about it, and he believes that’s what she always wanted and he’ll support her. Miyuki realizes the reality that she could be dependent on Natsumi. Miyuki goes wandering around and ends up at a car parts showcase she sees Honda-san. They have a heart-to-heart talk about what it means to let go for someone’s career.

title.jp: The Bus Stop that Passed By

synopsis: Natsumi packs and travels to the training grounds of her new job. Miyuki ponders some more and then starts shopping for herself and also for some gifts she can give her friends. Miyuki drops by the Zapper store to give Honda’s daughter Megumi a gift. But Honda just left for the bus station, and Megumi calls his cellphone. Miyuki goes to the bus stop to give the cellphone to Honda. At the bus stop they talk for a while and Miyuki breaks down and cries on Honda’s lap. Nakajima spots only the last part where they are hugging.

title.jp: The Man, Nakajima, Bear With It

synopsis: Nakajima struggles with the possibility that Miyuki might be in a relationship with Honda-san. He imagines several scenarios where she dumps him. Nakajima tries in some situations to tell her his feelings, but ends up as usual changing the subject. In the meantime, Natsumi returns to Boukutou on special assignment. They all have dinner together, but Nakajima goes off early to think about things more. He goes to a beach and helps some kids catch a hat that’s fallen in the water.

The tension is still increasing between Miyuki and Nakajima. The chief has a new assignment for everyone: to patrol for speeders taking residential road short-cuts that are off-limits during school/daytime hours. After lunch, Natsumi senses there’s still aloofness between Miyuki and Nakajima. She confronts Nakajima but he gets upset and leaves. Natsumi then confronts Miyuki and Miyuki responds with a SLAP! Uh oh.

Following their fallout, Miyuki then requests to be assigned a different partner. Natsumi is partnered with Saori for the rest of the speeders mission. Everyone kind of moves on with their assignment.
The bridge is nearing completion and the gang need to decorate for the opening ceremony.
Nakajima wins a trip to a hot springs resort and musters up enough courage to ask Miyuki out. With the rest of the gang tagging along, will Nakajima finally get to propose?
